truth: -  "Copyright law protects original works of authorship including literary, dramatic, musical, and artistic works."
fiction: -  "Copyright law protects original culinary recipes and the unique taste of food dishes."

truth: -  "Patents provide exclusive rights to inventors for their inventions for a limited period, typically 20 years."
fiction: -  "Patents provide lifetime exclusive rights to inventors for their inventions."

truth: -  "Trademarks protect brand names and logos used on goods and services."
fiction: -  "Trademarks protect the physical appearance and personal style of celebrities."

truth: -  "Intellectual property law includes laws related to patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets."
fiction: -  "Intellectual property law includes laws related to personal beliefs, opinions, and memories."

truth: -  "Trade secrets involve practices, designs, formulas, processes, or patterns that are not generally known or reasonably ascertainable."
fiction: -  "Trade secrets involve personal secrets, gossip, and undisclosed personal information."

truth: -  "Infringement of intellectual property rights can result in legal action and penalties."
fiction: -  "Infringement of intellectual property rights can result in public shaming and social ostracism."

truth: -  "Fair use is a legal doctrine that promotes freedom of expression by permitting the unlicensed use of copyright-protected works in certain circumstances."
fiction: -  "Fair use is a legal doctrine that allows anyone to freely use copyrighted works without any restrictions."

truth: -  "Intellectual property rights are territorial, which means they only give protection in the countries where they are granted or registered."
fiction: -  "Intellectual property rights are universal, providing protection globally regardless of where they are granted or registered."

truth: -  "A patent must be applied for and granted by the patent office in order to protect an invention."
fiction: -  "A patent is automatically granted as soon as an invention is created."

truth: -  "Plagiarism is not a legal concept; it's an ethical violation that can have professional consequences."
fiction: -  "Plagiarism is a legal offense that can result in imprisonment."

truth: -  "Intellectual property law does not protect ideas; it protects the expression of ideas."
fiction: -  "Intellectual property law protects any idea that pops into your head, even if you haven't done anything with it."

truth: -  "A copyright owner has the exclusive right to reproduce, distribute, perform, display, license, and to prepare derivative works based on the copyrighted work."
fiction: -  "A copyright owner has the exclusive right to read minds and control the thoughts of others based on the copyrighted work."

truth: -  "The Berne Convention is an international agreement governing copyright, which was first accepted in Berne, Switzerland, in 1886."
fiction: -  "The Berne Convention is an annual gathering of copyright owners in Berne, Switzerland, where they trade and sell copyrights."

truth: -  "The World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations that promotes the protection of intellectual property worldwide."
fiction: -  "The World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) is a secret society that controls all intellectual property worldwide."

truth: -  "A utility patent protects the way an article is used and works, while a design patent protects the way an article looks."
fiction: -  "A utility patent protects the emotional utility an article provides, while a design patent protects the way an article makes people feel."

truth: -  "The term of a new patent is 20 years from the date on which the application for the patent was filed in the United States."
fiction: -  "The term of a new patent lasts forever and is passed down through generations."

truth: -  "A copyright notice is not required for a work to be protected by copyright law."
fiction: -  "A copyright notice must be tattooed on the author for a work to be protected by copyright law."

truth: -  "The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) criminalizes production and dissemination of technology, devices, or services intended to circumvent measures that control access to copyrighted works."
fiction: -  "The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) allows anyone to freely distribute and reproduce digital content without any restrictions."

truth: -  "A trademark can be renewed indefinitely as long as it is being used in commerce."
fiction: -  "A trademark expires after 10 years and cannot be renewed."

truth: -  "A patent application must include a written description of the invention and how to make and use the invention."
fiction: -  "A patent application must include a detailed biography of the inventor and their inspiration for the invention."

truth: -  "The 'first-sale doctrine' allows the purchaser of a legally produced copyrighted work to sell or otherwise dispose of that particular copy, despite the interests of the copyright owner."
fiction: -  "The 'first-sale doctrine' allows the purchaser of a copyrighted work to reproduce
